result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frank Joseph Herrera Jr

Final pre-trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Frank Joseph Herrera Jr in court.  Attorney Samuel J. Sarver in court for Frank Joseph Herrera Jr.  Attorney Jessica R. Gereau in court for State of Wisconsin.  Motion to lift no  contact, state objects. defense doesn't oppose.  Court denies request.  Parties may reach stipulation re: contact. Present bond continued
Plea hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Frank Joseph Herrera in court with attorney Samuel J. Sarver.  Defendant Frank Joseph Herrera in custody.  Asst. District Attorney Jonathan Gigot appears on behalf of the State.  Present bond continued  Plea hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Frank Joseph Herrera in court with attorney Samuel J. Sarver.  Defendant Frank Joseph Herrera in custody.  Assistant District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State.  Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Plea negotiations placed on the record.
Court accepts waiver/finds probable cause and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
